docs.text: the best thing -- in fact , the only good thing -- i can say about dark city is that it made me want to go see l . a . confidential again .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or go rent body heat , to see william hurt do some real noir .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or even -- god help me -- palmetto .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: alex proyas's new movie screams atmosphere .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i screamed , too , " get me out of this theater ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: new line cinema spent millions of dollars creating the expressionistic film noir visuals and paying the actors , and doesn't have any way to get it back .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i paid $4 . 25 for a matinee screening and don't have any way to get my money back , either .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you'll hear a lot from other critics about the look and feel of this movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i will admit that the cinematographers and costume designers and set artists and cgi graphics geeks all worked hard to create a stunning , nightmarish future world where it's always a late night in 1948 , complete with rotary phones and automats and fedoras .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i've got news for you fellows -- i don't care how hard you worked , or how visually stunning this movie looks -- you wasted your time and mine , working on a movie without a plot , without a clear sense of direction of where it wanted to go , without a soul or a reason to care .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie starts out oh-so-promising .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: john murdoch ( rufus sewell ) is lying in a bathtub in the sort of seedy hotel that in real life , would have been boarded up long ago .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there is a dead , mutilated prostitute in the other room -- a surprise , as he has lost his memory .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the phone rings : it's a sinister-sounding man , claiming to be his doctor , telling him to flee for his life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all well and good , right ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wrong .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: apparently , someone decided that the audience was just a bit too dim to figure out the intricacies of the plot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( this is getting to be a popular assumption in hollywood . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so , the actual beginning of the movie is not sewell running for his life , rather , it's a voice-over narration by the aforementioned doctor ( keifer sutherland ) explaining exactly what is going on and who is responsible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's as though sam the piano player had told us that rick and ilsa had been getting it on in paris in the first three minutes of casablanca .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no , wait , that's not fair to casablanca .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's more like watching a new plotline at the first of the show -- or if you want to know how i really feel , having an off-screen narrator explain that gilligan won't be getting off the island in this episode .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: >from here , the coherence of the plot goes down faster than ( insert monica lewinsky joke here ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the characters just wander around the city aimlessly and bump into each other for no apparent reason , and that's what moves the plot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what we're left with is a string of unanswered questions that don't make any sense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we're given aliens with unlimited omnipotent powers , yet they forget to use them at critical moments and get themselves killed .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we're given a hero who can " tune " into these same powers , yet he only uses them when it's convenient to the plot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we're given a whole long list of loose ends that go nowhere
docs.label: negative

docs.text: usually , critics will say that an actor playing an underwritten part " isn't given much to do . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in this movie , no one is given anything to do .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sewell is given the impossible role of a man who doesn't remember anything , and plays it like . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: um . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a man who doesn't remember anything .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the aliens are tall , pasty-faced , and bald , and wear long black cloaks and fedoras to remind us that they're evil -- and there's a child alien as well , straight out of an anne rice novel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sutherland is saddled with a limp , a twitchy eye , and a breathy accent to remind us that he's in league with the aliens .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to its credit , dark city boasts two impressive bits of casting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: william hurt is perfectly cast as the world-weary inspector charged with catching the man who is murdering prostitutes all over the city .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jennifer connelly , playing sewell's love interest , is given two all-too-brief moments on screen as a lounge singer -- and turns in the sexiest performace this side of jessica rabbit .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but instead of the dogged policeman and the femme fatale given central treatment in the script ( the way they would be in any self-respecting noir movie ) they're almost tangiential to the plot , such as it is .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the problem with dark city is this : it's a bad science fiction movie pretending to be film noir .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the essence of film noir isn't , as proyas seems to beleive , breathy dialogue or snap-brim fedoras or tall , bald evil villains who would make peter lorre curl up in a corner .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: dark city has not one bit of intrigue , moral ambiguity , suspense , or anything else that keeps us coming back to the noir classics .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: dark city is like the intricately carved door that kate winslet floats on in titanic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's an exceptionlly well-made and intricately designed piece of flotsam , sailing around and around the middle of the ocean , going nowhere .
docs.label: negative
